content: Hey everyone! I'd like to contribute to miri (is this the right place to ask?) and am looking for a good starting point. Any recommendations? I don't mind jumping into the deep end of things by any means, so if there are no obvious low hanging fruit for a beginner something more involved is alright too.
I think shims are a good starting point. Check the issue tracker

is this the right place to ask?

If you mean https://github.com/rust-lang/miri, I think #miri is a better place.
I didn't know #miri existed ahahahah I feel bad :(
This is an okay place to ask though we should probably move this to #miri (but only mods can move topics across streams I think)

beyond what @Christian Poveda suggested, we also have some issues marked 'easy'. Now, easy is relative; 'easy' in Miri is usually more tricky than 'easy' in rustc. But still, assuming you have some Rust experience, those should also be good issues to start with.
I'm also happy to do some mentoring, though my availability is mostly restricted to weekends -- during the week I might have bits of time here and there, but not a lot
Hm, I now realize maybe you didn't mean Miri the tool but you meant the core CTFE engine of the rustc compiler, sometimes also called "Miri engine" or (confusingly) "Miri"...

Hey @RalfJ , thanks for getting back to this. Midterms week has been kicking my butt so haven't gotten to anything yet but am planning on starting today. With regards to your last point, I think I meant "miri the end product" so I suppose that includes both the tool and the CTFE stuff. I'll take a look at either the before mentioned issues or one of the easy ones and just start trying things.
@Jake okay, cool. :) If it's about the tool (is that what you mean by "end product"?), probably better use #miri for further discussion (or just comment on the issues)
However, it's going to be a busy week for me, so I cannot promise to be very reactive until the next weekend
That said, there are other people hanging out in #miri so if you have questions that's still a good place to ask :D
